Terrorbirds (Aves Terror) are animals which are used by the gnomes as mounts. Despite their fearsome appearance, they are not aggressive at all. They are involved in the Rag and Bone Man quest. Terrorbirds count for the bird Slayer task.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

Achievement[edit | edit source]

  • Guardian of the Realm ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Asgarnia & Misthalin.
    • Cornucopia drop

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • update 29 March 2004 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The terrorbird is probably based on Phorusrhacids, apex predators that lived during the Cenozoic Era, which are nicknamed "terror birds".
  • Terrorbirds are likely poor climbers as referenced by a gnome trainer while proceeding to the advanced section of the agility course[1].

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Gnome trainer, "Gnome Agility Course", RuneScape. "Terrorbirds could climb faster than that!"
